text: John Mahon (12 February 1940 – 23 November 2014) was an Australian rules footballer who played with Collingwood in the Victorian Football League (VFL) during the 1960s. After playing 30 games in his two years at Collingwood, Mahon injured his ankle in 1963 and made just one appearance that season.AFL Tables: John Mahon He recovered to play all 23 games in 1964 and was Collingwood's centre half-back in the grand final side which lost to Melbourne. He played one more season with Collingwood and then joined Victorian Football Association club Prahran.The Age,"Preston negotiating for League player", 7 June 1967, p. 11 The Mahon family used to own the Yarra Hotel in Abbotsford.The Age,"Pie fans' No. 1 draught pick", 27 September 2003, Paul Daffey ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Australian rules footballers from Victoria (Australia) Category:Collingwood Football Club players Category:Prahran Football Club players Category:People educated at Xavier College
